results.title: Lines and dots
results.brief_description: An animated experimental film in which we see blue dashes and red dots fighting each other when they are brought in close contact with an unknown third power - which destroys the embattled signs and spreads over the whole screen.
results.description: An animated experimental film in which we see blue dashes and red dots fighting each other when they are brought in close contact with an unknown third power - which destroys the embattled signs and spreads over the whole screen.

results.title: Lines - horizontal (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: An experiment in pure design by film artists Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart. Lines, ruled directly on film, move with precision and grace against a background of changing colours in response to music specially composed for the film. Accompanied by American folk musician Pete Seeger on wind and string instruments. (Awards: Venice; Edinburgh; London)

results.title: Line to Tschierva hut
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, Pro Telephon Zurich and Alberto Cavalcanti
results.brief_description: Documents the effort by Swiss and British engineers to lay a telephone line to an alpine hut in Switzerland’s Roseg Valley. The films shows some of the hazards encountered and the difficulties overcome in establishing telephone communication through the mountainous, but beautiful, countryside. Cinematography, John Taylor. Music, Maurice Jaubert.

results.title: Line of Least Resistance
results.brief_description: A revealing documentary about the lives of six unemployed teenagers in the Ballarat region. It was made by the unemployed themselves.
results.description: A revealing documentary about the lives of six unemployed teenagers in the Ballarat region. It was made by the unemployed themselves.

results.title: Line of balance
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Walter Storey
results.brief_description: Line of balance is a programming technique developed by production engineers to plan and control manufacturing processes in factories. Illustrates adaption for use on building sites. Uses animation to explain the basic principles of the techniques, and shows use of the management disciplines of mass production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Walter Storey

results.title: Line and Nantha (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Line and Nantha are a couple trying to overcome the restrictive sex-role conditioning they were taught as they were growing up. Nantha talks about his family life in Malaysia and Line describes the everyday sexism of her family in Quebec. They are trying to become a couple and to create a relationship that is egalitarian.

results.title: Line (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Points out that variations in the qualities of lines may be found in nature-lines or rocks, lines on the back of a tiger, and the trail lines made by a snail. Combining photography with animation, illustrates line movement and suggests to children the creative possibilities of materials such as thread, rope and wire as well as paint, chalk and crayon.
